p: This compound of a cadinene skeleton with a unique 1,2,4-trioxane segment, responsible for antimalarial activity of A. annua, was discovered in 1972 by Professor Tu's team. This discovery was recognized by her receipt of the Nobel Prize in medicine in 2015 [ 5, 6]. Due to this discovery, as one of the most important achievements for the natural products chemistry in last decades of the twentieth century , A. annua is now rated as one of the top ten industrial crops of the modern world.
